properties.description: A drop in social group on Tuesdays 1.30-4pm at Steeple Village Hall.   Activities include: table quizzes, bingo, raffle and computer support.   As well as lots of cake, sausage rolls, bottomless tea and coffee, there is plenty of chat and laughs. All for £4.   Please note: Pink and green recycling sacks are available for collection from the group.
properties.title: Steeple Warm Spaces – Coffee, Cakes & Company

properties.description: Community in a Cup is a weekly drop-in on Thursdays 2-4pm at Burnham United Reformed Church (URC).   It offers free refreshments, craft activities and social opportunities. Whilst Dengie Food Pantry users can pick up from here.   On the 3rd Thursday of each month you can speak to different community groups and organisations about the help and support that's available locally.   Come along to find out more. All are welcome.
properties.title: Burnham Warm Spaces – Community in a Cup

properties.description: The clubhouse will be open on Wednesday's, 2pm-6pm throughout the winter, with free hot drinks and a selection of soups available. Along with this, activities will be provided for all ages to enjoy whilst in the building. The Warm Welcome Space has been created to help those struggling with the current cost of living. We provide somewhere for anyone to come in and keep warm, enjoy a cuppa and simple make friends with other members in the community. Essex County Council is helping residents to find out what support is available to them. Information can be found by clicking here or searching Essex County Council Cost of Living Hub. Our Winter Warm Welcome Space will run from December 21st 2022 through to March 29th 2023 (December 28th closed) . We look forward to welcoming you.
properties.title: Southminster United – Warm Space

properties.description: Knightswood, through its various well-being services, provides invaluable care and support to the local, elderly and often socially isolated members of the community and those living with dementia. Growing old often brings many challenges, but Knightswood believe that life is still there to be enjoyed and lived as independently as possible. Our amazing team of professional carers and dedicated volunteers provide a compassionate service, creating a brighter, more independent future for the older generation and those living with dementia. Knightswood not only support the clients themselves but provide invaluable respite to their families too. At the heart, is our Day Centre, offering a safe haven to mostly the elderly but open to anyone who needs us due to their physical, mental or social requirements. Here you can find: invaluable respite care not only to clients but also their families, bringing much-needed breathing space; Me, Myself & I, a dedicated support group caring for those living with advanced dementia; a sensory room offering stimulation to those with Alzheimer's and other forms of dementia; a sociable lounge full of life and laughter; a dining room serving nutritious hot food to be enjoyed with friends; a therapy and shower room for personal care; accessible transport to get people safely to us and home again; a picturesque garden overlooking the countryside perfect for mental relaxation. Me, Myself & I is a dedicated support centre within Knightswood, specifically for those living with advanced dementia. Here, our dementia trained carers engage almost one-to-one with our clients to meet their needs, providing mental and physical stimulation for them, and respite for their carers at home. www.knightswoodcare.co.uk
properties.title: Knightswood Care
